page.title: 12Blackpool Airport (cont.)
page.content: The aircraft should unload its passengers or freight and keep the runway clear for the next aircraft, which may be fast approaching the runway. When an aircraft has loaded its fuel,baggage and passengers the pilot makes a radio call to the aerodrome controller for permission to start engines.The controller tells him when to start so there will not be a delay in the air or on the ground. Air traffic control is also responsible for the safety of the aircraft on the ground,and their responsibility only ends when the aircraft is finally parked on the apron. For departing aircraft,the controller is responsible until he hands the aircraft over to another airspace.
